FuncDef:
The fail-ratio command configures the test failure ratio for NQA generalflow tests.
The undo fail-ratio command restores the default test failure ratio for NQA generalflow tests.
By default, the test failure ratio for NQA generalflow tests is 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the one in ten thousands ratio of test failure for NQA generalflow tests.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 100 with one in ten thousands ratio.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When an NQA test instance starts, it will send multiple probe packets in each test. Network quality is checked by the data collected through multiple probe packets.
In actual situations, interference in the network can cause a probe failure. However, a single probe failure does not indicate the failure of the whole. A probe failure can be judged by setting one in ten thousands ratio for NQA test failures. A probe failure will be defined if failed probe packets of the total reach a certain ratio.
Prerequisites
The type of NQA test instance has been configured as generalflow.
Precautions
You cannot change the test failure ratio of a running test instance.
